newsitem.title: SWEDEN: FORECAST - Sweden '97 borrowing need seen 33 bln skr.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Sweden '97 borrowing need seen 33 bln skr.

text.p: Sweden's borrowing requirement for 1997 was expected to be around 33 billion crowns, based on an average from a Reuters poll of 10 analysts.

"Even if the budget deficit is cut and the economy picks up, the government's borrowing need will increase from this year's 20-30 billion crowns," said HSBC Midland's Peter Lindqvist, who forecast the borrowing need at 55 billion crowns.
"The year's extremely low borrowing need is largely due to one-off items totalling around 60 billion crowns."
The National Debt Office will present its first forecast for the 1997 borrowing need on October 24 at 0730 GMT.
Analysts interviewed for the poll were from Aragon, Carnegie, Consensus, Handelsbanken, Lehman Brothers, HSBC Midland, Paine Webber, Salomon Brothers, Swedbank and Unibank.
